name: Placement
description: Specifies how the element is placed relative to surrounding content (e.g., block-level or inline flow).
defaultValue: Block for BLSEs, Inline for ILSEs

values.name: Block
values.description: Stacked in the block-progression direction within an enclosing reference area or parent BLSE.

values.name: Inline
values.description: Packed in the inline-progression direction within an enclosing BLSE.

values.name: Before
values.description: Placed so that the before edge of the element’s allocation rectangle (see 14.8.5.4.5, "Content and Allocation Rectangles") coincides with that of the nearest enclosing reference area. The element may float, if necessary, to achieve the specified placement. The element shall be treated as a block occupying the full extent of the enclosing reference area in the inline direction. Other content shall be stacked so as to begin at the after edge of the element’s allocation rectangle.

values.name: Start
values.description: Placed so that the start edge of the element’s allocation rectangle (see 14.8.5.4.5, "Content and Allocation Rectangles") coincides with that of the nearest enclosing reference area. The element may float, if necessary, to achieve the specified placement. Other content that would intrude into the element’s allocation rectangle shall be laid out as a runaround.

values.name: End
values.description: Placed so that the end edge of the element’s allocation rectangle (see 14.8.5.4.5, "Content and Allocation Rectangles") coincides with that of the nearest enclosing reference area. The element may float, if necessary, to achieve the specified placement. Other content that would intrude into the element’s allocation rectangle shall be laid out as a runaround.

name: WritingMode
description: Defines the direction of text flow (e.g., left-to-right, right-to-left, or vertical).

values.name: LrTb
values.description: Inline progression from left to right; block progression from top to bottom. This is the typical writing mode for Western writing systems.

values.name: RlTb
values.description: Inline progression from right to left; block progression from top to bottom. This is the typical writing mode for Arabic and Hebrew writing systems.

values.name: TbRl
values.description: Inline progression from top to bottom; block progression from right to left. This is the typical writing mode for Chinese and Japanese writing systems.

values.name: TbLr
values.description: Inline progression from top to bottom; block progression from left to right. This is the typical writing mode for writing systems like classical Mongolian.

values.name: LrBt
values.description: Inline progression from left to right; block progression from bottom to top. There is currently no known writing system to which this writing mode applies.

values.name: RlBt
values.description: Inline progression from right to left; block progression from bottom to top. There is currently no known writing system to which this writing mode applies.

values.name: BtRl
values.description: Inline progression from bottom to top; block progression from right to left. This is the typical writing mode for the Ancient Berber writing system.

values.name: BtLr
values.description: Inline progression from bottom to top; block progression from left to right. This is the typical writing mode for the Batak writing system.

name: BackgroundColor
description: Sets the background color for the element’s content area.
defaultValue: If this attribute is not specified, the element shall be treated as if its background were transparent.

values.description: The value shall be an array of three numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0, representing the red, green, and blue values, respectively, of an RGB colour space

name: BorderColor
description: Specifies the color of the border around the element.
defaultValue: If this attribute is not specified, the border colour for this element shall be the current text fill colour in effect at the start of its associated content.

values.description: A single array of three numbers representing the RGB values to apply to all four edges.

An array of four arrays, each specifying the RGB values for one edge of the border, in the order of the before, after, start, and end edges. A value of null for any of the edges means that it shall not be drawn.

name: BorderStyle
description: Indicates the style of the border (e.g., solid, dashed, dotted).

values.name: None
values.description: No border. Forces the computed value of BorderThickness to be 0.

values.name: Hidden
values.description: Same as None, except in terms of border conflict resolution for table elements.

values.name: Dotted
values.description: The border is a series of dots.

values.name: Dashed
values.description: The border is a series of short line segments.

values.name: Solid
values.description: The border is a single line segment.

values.name: Double
values.description: The border is two solid lines. The sum of the two lines and the space between them equals the value of BorderThickness.

values.name: Groove
values.description: The border looks as though it were carved into the canvas.

values.name: Ridge
values.description: The border looks as though it were coming out of the canvas (the opposite of Groove).

values.name: Inset
values.description: The border makes the entire box look as though it were embedded in the canvas.

values.name: Outset
values.description: The border makes the entire box look as though it were coming out of the canvas (the opposite of Inset).

An array of four entries, each entry specifying the style for one edge of the border in the order of the before, after, start, and end edges. A value of null for any of the edges means that it shall not be drawn.
A name from the list below representing the border style to apply to all four edges.

name: BorderThickness
description: Defines the thickness of the border line in user space units (such as points).

values.description: A number representing the border thickness for all four edges

An array of four entries, each entry specifying the style for one edge of the border in the order of the before, after, start, and end edges. A value of null for any of the edges means that it shall not be drawn.

name: Padding
description: Determines the space between the element’s border (or boundary) and its inner content.

values.description: A number representing the width of the padding for all four edges.
An array of four entries, each entry specifying the width of the padding for one edge, in the order of the before, after, start and end edges.

name: Color
description: Applies the primary color (fill or stroke) for the text or graphic content.
defaultValue: If this attribute is not specified, the border colour for this element shall be the current text fill colour in effect at the start of its associated content

values.description: An array of three numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0, representing the red, green, and blue values, respectively, of an RGB colour space

name: SpaceBefore
description: Specifies the additional spacing before the element.

values.description: The amount of extra space preceding the before edge of the BLSE, measured in default user space units in the blockprogression direction

name: SpaceAfter
description: Specifies the additional spacing after the element.

values.description: The amount of extra space following the after edge of the BLSE, measured in default user space units in the blockprogression direction.

name: StartIndent
description: Defines the indentation at the start edge (left edge in LTR) of the element.

values.description: The distance from the start edge of the reference area to that of the BLSE, measured in default user space units in the inlineprogression direction.

name: EndIndent
description: Defines the indentation at the end edge (right edge in LTR) of the element.

values.description: The distance from the end edge of the BLSE to that of the reference area, measured in default user space units in the inlineprogression direction.

name: TextIndent
description: Specifies the indentation of the first line of text in a paragraph.

values.description: A negative value shall indicate a hanging indent.

name: TextAlign
description: Controls how text is aligned within the element (left, right, center, justify).

values.name: Start
values.description: Aligned with the start edge.

values.name: Center
values.description: Centred between the start and end edges.

values.name: End
values.description: Aligned with the end edge.

values.name: Justify
values.description: Aligned with both the start and end edges, with internal spacing within each line expanded, if necessary, to achieve such alignment. The last (or only) line shall be aligned with the start edge only.

name: BBox
description: Indicates the bounding box of the element, specifying its position and size on the page.

values.description: An array of four numbers in default user space units that shall give the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the structure element’s bounding box (the rectangle that completely encloses its visible content).

name: Width
description: Declares an explicit width for the element in user space units.

values.name: Auto
values.description: The name Auto in place of a numeric value shall indicate that no specific width constraint is to be imposed; the element’s width is determined by the intrinsic width of its content.
Measured in default user space units in the inline-progression direction.

name: Height
description: Declares an explicit height for the element in user space units.

values.name: Auto
values.description: The name Auto in place of a numeric value shall indicate that no specific width constraint is to be imposed; the element’s width is determined by the intrinsic width of its content.

values.name: Start
values.description: Measured in default user space units in the inline-progression direction.

name: BlockAlign
description: Specifies vertical alignment of a block-level element (e.g., top, middle, bottom) within its container.

values.name: Before
values.description: Before edge of the first child’s allocation rectangle aligned with that of the table cell’s content rectangle.

values.name: Middle
values.description: Children centred within the table cell. The distance between the before edge of the first child’s allocation rectangle and that of the table cell’s content rectangle shall be the same as the distance between the after edge of the last child’s allocation rectangle and that of the table cell’s content rectangle.

values.name: After
values.description: After edge of the last child’s allocation rectangle aligned with that of the table cell’s content rectangle.

values.name: Justify
values.description: Children aligned with both the before and after edges of the table cell’s content rectangle. The first child shall be placed as described for Before and the last child as described for After, with equal spacing between the children. If there is only one child, it shall be aligned with the before edge only, as for Before.

name: InlineAlign
description: Specifies how inline content is aligned within the line box (e.g., baseline, center).

values.name: Start
values.description: Start edge of each child’s allocation rectangle aligned with that of the table cell’s content rectangle.

values.name: Center
values.description: Each child centred within the table cell. The distance between the start edges of the child’s allocation rectangle and the table cell’s content rectangle shall be the same as the distance between their end edges.

values.name: End
values.description: End edge of each child’s allocation rectangle aligned with that of the table cell’s content rectangle.

name: TBorderStyle
description: Indicates the border style for table cells or similar tabular structures.

values.name: None
values.description: No border. Forces the computed value of BorderThickness to be 0.

values.name: Hidden
values.description: Same as None, except in terms of border conflict resolution for table elements.

values.name: Dotted
values.description: The border is a series of dots.

values.name: Dashed
values.description: The border is a series of short line segments.

values.name: Solid
values.description: The border is a single line segment.

values.name: Double
values.description: The border is two solid lines. The sum of the two lines and the space between them equals the value of BorderThickness.

values.name: Groove
values.description: The border looks as though it were carved into the canvas.

values.name: Ridge
values.description: The border looks as though it were coming out of the canvas (the opposite of Groove).

values.name: Inset
values.description: The border makes the entire box look as though it were embedded in the canvas.

values.name: Outset
values.description: The border makes the entire box look as though it were coming out of the canvas (the opposite of Inset).

An array of four entries, each entry specifying the style for one edge of the border in the order of the before, after, start, and end edges. A value of null for any of the edges means that it shall not be drawn.
A name from the list below representing the border style to apply to all four edges.

name: TPadding
description: Specifies the padding inside table cells or table-like elements.

values.description: A positive value shall enlarge the background area; a negative value shall trim it, and the border may overlap the element’s text or graphic. A single number representing the width of the padding, in default user space units, that applies to all four edges of the table cell.
A 4-entry array representing the padding width for the before edge, after edge, start edge, and end edge, respectively, of the content rectangle.

name: BaselineShift
description: Shifts the text baseline up or down (used for subscripts, superscripts, etc.).

values.description: The distance, in default user space units, by which the element’s baseline shall be shifted relative to that of its parent element.

name: LineHeight
description: Controls the spacing between lines of text (line spacing).

values.name: Normal
values.description: Adjust the line height to include any non-zero value specified for BaselineShift.

values.name: Auto
values.description: Adjustment for the value of BaselineShift shall not be made

values.name: Start
values.description: The element’s preferred height, measured in default user space units in the block-progression direction.

values.name: Sup
values.description: Position is elevated, like for superscript

values.name: Sub
values.description: Position is lowered, like for subscript

values.name: Normal
values.description: Position is neither elevated nor lowered

name: TextDecorationColor
description: Specifies the color used for text decorations (like underline or strike-through).
defaultValue: If this attribute is not specified, the text decoration colour for this element shall be the current fill colour in effect at the start of its associated content

values.description: An array of three numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0, representing the red, green, and blue values, respectively, of an RGB colour space.

name: TextDecorationThickness
description: Defines the thickness of any text decoration line.
defaultValue: If this attribute is not specified, it shall be derived from the current stroke thickness in effect at the start of the element’s associated content, transformed into default user space units.

values.description: The value shall be a non-negative number in default user space units representing the thickness (0 is interpreted as the thinnest possible line).

name: TextDecorationType
description: Indicates the type of text decoration (underline, overline, line-through).

values.name: None
values.description: No text decoration

values.name: Underline
values.description: A line below the text

values.name: Overline
values.description: A line above the text

values.name: LineThrough
values.description: A line through the middle of the text

name: RubyAlign
description: Controls how ruby text (primarily in East Asian typography) is aligned relative to its base text.

values.name: Start
values.description: The content shall be aligned on the start edge in the inline-progression direction

values.name: Center
values.description: The content shall be centred in the inline-progression direction.

values.name: End
values.description: The content shall be aligned on the end edge in the inline-progression direction.

values.name: Justify
values.description: The content shall be expanded to fill the available width in the inline-progression direction

values.name: Distribute
values.description: The content shall be expanded to fill the available width in the inline-progression direction. However, space shall also be inserted at the start edge and end edge of the text. The spacing shall be distributed using a 1:2:1 (start:infix:end) ratio. It shall be changed to a 0:1:1 ratio if the ruby appears at the start of a text line or to a 1:1:0 ratio if the ruby appears at the end of the text line.

name: RubyPosition
description: Specifies the placement of ruby text (above or below the base text).

values.name: Before
values.description: The RT content shall be aligned along the before edge of the element.

values.name: After
values.description: The RT content shall be aligned along the after edge of the element.

values.name: Warichu
values.description: The RT and associated RP elements shall be formatted as a warichu, following the RB element

values.name: Inline
values.description: The RT and associated RP elements shall be formatted as a parenthesis comment, following the RB element.

name: GlyphOrientationVertical
description: Determines the orientation of glyphs when text is written in a vertical writing mode.

values.name: Auto
values.description: Specifies a default orientation for text, depending on whether it is fullwidth (as wide as it is high). Fullwidth Latin and fullwidth ideographic text (excluding ideographic punctuation) shall be set with an angle of 0. Ideographic punctuation and other ideographic characters having alternate horizontal and vertical forms shall use the vertical form of the glyph. Non-fullwidth text shall be set with an angle of 90
A number representing the clockwise rotation in degrees of the top of the glyphs relative to the top of the reference area. Shall be a multiple of 90 degrees between -180 and +360.

name: ColumnCount
description: Specifies the number of columns for multi-column layouts.

values.description: The number of columns in the content of the grouping element.

name: ColumnGap
description: Indicates the spacing (gap) between columns in multi-column layouts.

values.description: It specifies the space between all columns.

It should contain numbers, the first element specifying the space between the first and second columns, the second specifying the space between the second and third columns, and so on. If there are fewer than ColumnCount - 1 numbers, the last element shall specify all remaining spaces; if there are more than ColumnCount - 1 numbers, the excess array elements shall be ignored.

name: ColumnWidths
description: Specifies the width of each column in multi-column layouts.

values.description: It specifies the width of all columns

It shall contain numbers, representing the width of each column, in order. If there are fewer than ColumnCount numbers, the last element shall specify all remaining widths; if there are more than ColumnCount numbers, the excess array elements shall be ignored

name: ListNumbering
description: Controls the numbering style used in lists (e.g., decimal, Roman, bullet).

values.name: None
values.description: No numbering system; Lbl elements (if present) contain arbitrary text not subject to any numbering scheme

values.name: Unordered
values.description: (PDF 2.0) Unordered list with unspecified bullets

values.name: Description
values.description: (PDF 2.0) A list of terms for corresponding definitions

values.name: Disc
values.description: Solid circular bullet

values.name: Circle
values.description: Open circular bullet

values.name: Square
values.description: Solid square

values.name: Ordered
values.description: (PDF 2.0) Ordered lists with unspecified numbering

values.name: Decimal
values.description: Decimal Arabic numerals (1–9, 10–99, … )

values.name: UpperRoman
values.description: Uppercase Roman numerals (I, II, III, IV, … )

values.name: LowerRoman
values.description: Lowercase Roman numerals (i, ii, iii, iv, … )

values.name: UpperAlpha
values.description: Uppercase letters (A, B, C, .. )

values.name: LowerAlpha
values.description: Lowercase letters (a, b, c, … )
A flag specifying whether the list is a continuation of a previous list in the structure tree (true), or not (false)
The ID of the list for which this list is a continuation

name: Role
description: Assigns a semantic role to the element for accessibility or structure mapping.

values.name: rb
values.description: Radio button

values.name: cp
values.description: Check box

values.name: pb
values.description: Push button

values.name: tv
values.description: Text-value field

values.name: lb
values.description: Listbox field

name: Checked, checked
description: Indicates whether a form field (like a checkbox) is in a checked state.

values.name: on
values.description: The state of a radio button or check box field

values.name: off
values.description: The state of a radio button or check box field

name: Desc
description: Provides a descriptive text for the element, often used for accessibility or annotations.

values.description: The alternate name of the field.
The number of rows in the enclosing table that shall be spanned by the cell.
The number of columns in the enclosing table that shall be spanned by the cell
An array of byte strings, where each string shall be the element identifier for a TH structure element that shall be used as a header associated with this cell
A summary of the table’s purpose and structure.
Contains a short form of the content of a TH structure element’s content.

values.name: Pagination
values.description: Pagination artifacts are ancillary page features such as running heads or folios (page numbers)

values.name: Layout
values.description: Layout artifacts are purely cosmetic typographical or design elements such as footnote rules or decorative ornaments

values.name: Page
values.description: Page artifacts are production aids extraneous to the document itself, such as cut marks and print control patches

values.name: Inline
values.description: Inline artifacts enclose artifact content that has context in the document’s logical structure, typically, artifacts of subtype LineNum or Redaction

An array of four numbers in default user space units giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the artifact’s bounding box (the rectangle that completely encloses its visible extent).

name: NoteType
description: The type of the FENote indicating a more specific semantic definition for the FENote

values.name: Footnote
values.description: A subtype indicating a footnote

values.name: Endnote
values.description: A subtype indicating an endnote

values.name: None
values.description: A subtype indicating that the type is not specified
